name: Four Points by Sheraton San Francisco Bay Bridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I have stayed at this property a few times. We do not have many complaints. It meets our need and it is good for the price. It is not a true four star property but if you are looking for one, there are many of them in SF that are much more expensive. The front desk staff does seem to lack training and they are not the most knowledgeable. Plenty of free parking is great as compared to what you would pay in downtown SF hotels. The rooms are nice and clean, and big enough for our needs, although the bathrooms are pretty small. The sink is actually located outside the bathroom and you still have trouble closing the door without getting in the way. The few times we have ordered room service, it has been decent and fast, but you may be better off going to a local dinner for better food, at lower price. Street/freeway noise has never been an issue for me (except when cops pull someone over which seems to happen rather often at the intersection) My main complaint is that the "Four Comforts Bed" always leaves me with a sore back, but I guess different people have different preferences for the bed softness. The last time I wanted to stay here though, I found that the price at the Hilton Garden Inn was lower. I stayed there and was impressed with the size and amenities of this other hotel. If I can not get a lower rate at the Four Points, the Hilton will definitely be the better choice.
reviews.title: Good hotel for its price range

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, free business center, close to shopping/movies
likes.disliked: — Bed not very comfortable, bathroom too small

reviews.text: I book this place for my sister when she came into town to visit. Out of all the choices in the Emeryville 'hotel hub', it was the least expensive.
reviews.title: Pretty good....but nothing to rave about

reviews.text: Pros: pretty good view of the city from the 7th floor (bay side); plenty of parking; very accessible; clean room.
reviews.title: Noisy and Plain -- Try the Marriot or Hilton Instead
Great Location
reviews.text: Cons: The kitchen had some kind of a problem, and informed guests that it would be closed for business. I can't remember if it was for one night or multiple nights, but that gives you an idea of what kind of hotel you're dealing with -- you don't come here for the food!!
Also, the hotel floor had that smell you expect in a Motel 6. The room was fine, but not the hallway.
reviews.title: A good hotel
Solid Value
reviews.text: Stayed here on April 23, 2004. Room was clean and very spacious. The hotel even honored my request for a room with a view of the SF skyline. Unfortunately, you mostly see fog and/or treasure island. Walls are pretty thick so you hear little noise although you definitely hear people in the hallway. Good value for money, would stay here again.

reviews.title: We got the Small Room Next to Elevator

reviews.text: Unfortunately, we received the small room immediately next to the elevator (Room 617) which has about 2 or 3 feet less width than all the other rooms in the hotel. Even though space in the room was tight and the bed was only a full size bed (queen or king would be better), the furnishings and amenities were wonderful. Since we were in a hurry and speniding almost no time (except our time sleeping) in the room, we didn't bother complaining about the room size, and just went with it.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Really Nice Staff
reviews.text: Very convenient location 1 block from I-80. In the morning, we drove under the freeway out to the bay, and enjoyed quiet solitude with outstanding views of the bay.

reviews.title: A Great Hotel
reviews.text: I stayed three nights while on a business trip. The hotel was clean, quiet, and the staff professional. I stayed on the fifth floor facing east. The only caution I would advise is that railroad tracks run a few hundred feet from the hotel on the other side of Shellmound Street. Frequent train traffic passes through the area and I was awakened once by train horns. Most of the time though noise didn't bother me. If you're a light sleeper you may want to ask for a room on the west side.

reviews.title: Does the job
reviews.text: I didn't eat in the restaurant which looked like the usual hotel dining room. There's also a small bar just off the lobby. Nearby choices are mainly limited to a couple of chain restaurants and fast food, except for the food court in the Emeryville City Market which had a good assortment of take-out-type ethnic food. The Emery Go-Round is a free bus that runs to the BART station which makes for easy access to the greater Bay area. The Emeryville Amtrak station is just a short distance away as well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We fly to Berkeley between two and four times a year to visit our two grandsons. We almost always stay at the Sheraton Four Points in Emeryville. It is very convenient for us whether we are driving into San Francisco or anywhere in the East Bay area. This time our stay was for four days.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are always clean and the front desk staff are always helpful and courteous. Room rates are competitive for the area. There is free "wired" high speed internet service in all the rooms and wifi in the lobby. There is free newspaper delivered to the room each weekday.
reviews.title: Great location Berkeley CA

likes.disliked: — Old style small room with small sink area in entryway

reviews.text: The only complaint is that the hotel restaurant is not opened for all three meal times but acceptable room service is available. Additionally, there is a Lyon's Restaurant right next door and a Denny's across the street. Numerous other restaurants are close by.
reviews.title: Solid Property in Great Location

likes.disliked: — Room smelled somewhat stale on arrival; air conditioning was not turned on before we arrived although it was very hot that day

reviews.text: Stayed comfortably for six nights. All staff, from the front desk, to the cleaning staff and restaurant were extremely helpful and polite. When I requested a cup of coffee in the restaurant even though they were not open, the gentleman gave me a free espresso instead. Beds were comfy and room was in good condition. Great location and access to freeways. There is even a shuttle that will take you to the bart station. A wide range of restaurants are within walking distance. And if you're looking for snacks, Trader Joe's is just across the street. The only downside is that even as a platinum SPG guest, there is no club room for complimentary evening snacks and free continental breakfast. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: A great find

reviews.text: Our family stayed here on a Saturday night and were very impressed with the "Four Points by Sheraton" concept. The hotel is conveniently located just off Highway 80 near the Bay Bridge. There are tons of shopping and restaurant possibilities within both walking and short driving distances. The hotel's restaurant is average but it does offer a nice breakfast buffet in the morning at a reasonble price along with plated options. There is also a Lyon's Restaurant in the parking lot for variety if you are staying longer than one day.
reviews.title: A good choice in the Bay Area

aka: Four Points By Sheraton San Francisco Bay Bridge Hotel
description: Centrally located, the Four Points by Sheraton San Francisco Bay Bridge is near downtown San Francisco and Oakland, and the Napa and Sonoma Valleys are a scenic drive from our newly renovated hotel.
